project_title.value: D-Series Powertrain Upgrade Project for Tier 5, also encompassing projects like CBE-2 UPGRADE EURO8 CLUTCH SYSTEM and Gen-2 Upgrade Tier-5 Clutch Assembly.

project_description.value: The project involves the design, fabrication, machining, thermal processing, and assembly of powertrain and heavy-duty clutch components (including cover, disc, and release bearing) for the Global Motors Consortium's D-Series Powertrain Upgrade. This includes multiple RFQs (e.g., EU-A-25-228, NA-P-25-50, G-FS-N-24-205) for brands like Germanic Automotive, Norse Trucks, and American Hauler Inc. across EU, North American, and South American markets.

contracting_authority.value: Global Motors Consortium (GMC) and its brands, including Germanic Automotive, Norse Trucks, and American Hauler Inc.

contract_duration.value: The contract period is from 2028 to the end of 2033.

location_of_works_services.value: The supplier, Axion Automotive, operates from multiple sites including production, delivery, and development locations in Stuttgart (Germany), Sao Paulo (Brazil), Lyon (France), Ghent (Belgium), Nantes (France), and Hamburg (Germany).

contact_person_details.value: Key contacts include: A. Dubois (Key Account Manager, a.dubois@axion-auto.com, +32 9 240 88 11), Stefan Meier (Sales, stefan.meier@axionauto.com, +49 40 555 9012), M. Janssen (Head of Customer Quality, m.janssen@axion-auto.com, +32 9 240 88 22), and S. Vercauteren (Lead Application Engineer, s.vercauteren@axion-auto.com, +32 9 240 88 44).

rfq_issue_date.value: Multiple RFQs are involved, including GFS-NT-P-24-208 issued on 2024-04-10.

contract_award_date.value: Supplier nomination and tooling kickoff is scheduled for CW39/2025.

contract_start_date.value: Start of Production (SOP) is scheduled for 2028-11-01.

contract_completion_date.value: The contract period ends at the end of 2033.

scope_of_work.value: Design, production, and supply of drivetrain components, including heavy-duty clutch kits (cover, disc, bearing) and control boxes for the D-Series Powertrain Upgrade. This covers activities from R&D, prototyping, and validation to serial production and after-sales support.

methodology_requirements.value: The supplier utilizes a V-process for development, maintains traceability via a Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) system, and uses quality methods such as FMEA, QFD, and DOE. NVH will be validated on the vehicle.

technical_specifications.value: Key specifications include compliance with GMS-4519980 rev 1, a durability target of 2.5 million km, burst speed of 5500 rpm, minimum wear capacity of 4.0 mm, and a clutch disc stiffness of 210 Nm/° ±10%.

required_outputs_deliverables.value: Deliverables include prototype samples (P1 by 2025-09-15), pre-production samples (by 2026-05-20), PPAP submission (by 2028-06-01), and serial parts for SOP (by 2028-11-01). Required documentation includes a spare parts concept (ETK), technical documentation (per GA 451-7), and service literature (operating instructions, repair manuals).

equipment_or_materials.value: Special tools are required for service, and Germanic Automotive must be granted a license for their reproduction. The supplier uses CAD systems (CATIA V5, Siemens NX), simulation tools for FEA and NVH, and various lab equipment including CMM 3D metrology and SEM.

site_access_requirements.value: The supplier must grant access to business and plant premises for audits and reviews.

data_management_standards.value: The supplier must use the e-Qualify platform for initial sampling (e-IS) and complaints (e-Feedback). Data must be supplied to the Global Materials Database (GMDS) for every part number. EDI processing for DELORD, SHIPADV, and DELJIT call-offs is required.

mandatory_supplier_information.value: Supplier: Axion Automotive. DUNS numbers for various sites include 682928055 (Ghent/Nantes), 345678912 (Hamburg), 862945137 (Leganes). Customer-specific supplier IDs include 87009456 (GATB) and 831612 (Norse Trucks).

financial_thresholds.value: The supplier's total annual turnover is 210 million EUR.

health_and_safety_compliance.value: Compliance with product safety and liability requirements is confirmed, though the drivetrain component is not classified as a safety-critical item. Safety Data Sheets compliance is confirmed.

certifications_and_accreditations.value: The supplier holds IATF 16949 (valid until 2024-11-30 for Hamburg site, also held for Novaterra site), ISO 9001 (valid until 2024-09-14 for Hamburg site), and ISO 14001:2015 (valid until 2026-04-14 for Bordeaux site).

references_and_experience.value: The supplier is a serial supplier to commercial vehicle OEMs and has existing business with Norse Trucks, Germanic Automotive, Euro Transmissions, and Powertrain Solutions AG, supplying parts like clutch kits and dual-clutch units.

key_personnel_qualifications.value: Safety managers are required to have completed qualification training, though the supplier has marked this as not relevant for this specific project.

subcontractor_requirements.value: The supplier must ensure transparency and responsibility in the supply chain, including for external service providers and sub-suppliers like Precision Bearings Co. for ball bearings.

technical_criteria.value: Evaluation is based on compliance with technical specifications, drawings, and standards, as detailed in compliance matrices and technical checklists. This includes performance metrics like durability, burst speed, and wear capacity.

commercial_criteria.value: Evaluation includes piece price, tooling costs, R&D costs, and adherence to Long Term Agreement (LTA) discount structures. The supplier has expressed interest in Supply Chain Finance.

scoring_system.value: A successful quality audit requires a score of 90% or higher, conducted by Germanic Automotive or another Global Motors Consortium brand.

award_decision_basis.value: Criteria for awarding contracts are mentioned as a compliance point, but the specific basis for the decision is not detailed.

pricing_format.value: Pricing is provided per piece with a Long Term Agreement (LTA) offering a -1.25% annual discount. For 2028, the total kit price is 272.50 EUR. Volume-based scenarios are also quoted (e.g., 275.50 EUR for 50% Europe volume). Total R&D and tooling costs are 405,000 EUR.

price_inclusions.value: The quotation includes ink marking for the clutch cover and has factored in the packaging plan. Potential costs for decarbonization solutions are not integrated.

invoicing_requirements.value: Billing of costs due to defective parts is a specified requirement.

terms_and_conditions.value: Terms are governed by the updated General Supply Agreement (GSA) dated 15/11/2025, which covers warranty claims, liability, and field observation obligations.

acceptance_of_terms.value: The supplier has confirmed acknowledgement and acceptance of quality standards including 'Quality Framework Alpha' and 'GMC CVS15'.

confidentiality_requirements.value: Multiple documents, including the Consolidated Checklists and cost breakdowns, are marked as 'Confidential'. Document retention policies like 'Class 0.3 – S + 5 Years' are specified.

intellectual_property_rights.value: The supplier holds local patents for clutch discs, including 'advanced spring seat architecture' and 'anti-burst safety features'. For any required special tools, the supplier must grant Germanic Automotive a license to reproduce them.

self_declaration_requirements.value: The supplier has completed multiple self-declarations, including a Supplier Self-Assessment (SSA), a compliance statement for Norse Trucks Standard NT-4500, and various consolidated checklists for quality, logistics, and R&D.

evidence_submission_timing.value: IMDS data is required for first sample release and series release. Technical documentation is required before Start of Production (SOP).

sustainability_commitments.value: The supplier holds ISO 14001 certification for environmental management. They comply with material regulations such as GADSL, REACh, Biocide, and RoHS, and confirm compliance with requirements for using recycled materials. Potential costs for future decarbonization solutions are noted but not yet priced.

contract_management_arrangements.value: The supplier will use the customer's 'e-Qualify' platform for managing initial sampling (e-IS) and zero-kilometer complaints (e-Feedback).

key_project_milestones.value: Key milestones include: Supplier nomination (CW39/2025), Design freeze (CW44/2025), Prototype samples (P1) delivery (2025-09-15), Pre-production samples delivery (2026-05-20), Final Design & Process Review (FDPR) (CW03/2028), PPAP submission (2028-06-01), and Start of Production (SOP) (2028-11-01).

quality_assurance_measures.value: Quality assurance includes a required quality audit score of >=90%, use of FMEA, a Design Verification Plan & Report (DVP&R), error-proofing (Poka-Yoke) methods, and component markings to prevent assembly mistakes. Production batch traceability and FIFO are guaranteed.
